Issues.Title: Memory getting increased when dynamically change values?
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/.... ### Is this a regression? Don't know ### Description I have created one angular project with grid control, when i change grid colums dynamically, memory getting increased, i don't know why it is getting increased. Here i am doing destroy properly but memory getting increased. I could not solve this issue ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Step 1: download sample using below link [ [http://www.syncfusion.com/downloads/support/directtrac/general/ze/memoryLeak673661023](http://www.syncfusion.com/downloads/support/directtrac/general/ze/memoryLeak673661023) ] Step 2: Run following commands > npm install > npm start Step 3: Then you will see application demo in `http://localhost:3000/`. First take screenshot for memory initially. Step 4: Then press start button and wait for 15 secs, then you will see **console window** show message like **`15 completed`**. Then again take screenshot for to check memory size Step 5: Finally you will see memory leak ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version: 5.2.0** **npm Version:5.6.0** **node Version: v8.11.3** **Anything else relevant?** I have referred below two links and tried methods which are prescribed in those link but they wont solve this issue https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22397484/how-to-reduce-remove-memory-leaks-in-angular-application https://www.twilio.com/blog/prevent-memory-leaks-angular-observable-ngondestroy

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): proper resolution of Enums in Component decorator
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change Component decorator was resolving `encapsulation` value a bit incorrectly, which resulted in `encapsulation: NaN` in compiled code. Now we resolve the value as Enum member and throw if it's not the case. As a part of this update, the `changeDetection` field handling is also added, the resolution logic is the same as the one used for `encapsulation` field.

This PR resolves issue FW-722.

## PR Type

- [x] Bugfix

- [x] No

Issues.Title: ServiceWorker: Standard NavigationUrls do not respect baseHref
Issues.Body:
Copied from https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/13368

//cc @DanielHabenicht

### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report
- [] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
-->


### Repro steps
```
ng new repro-app
ng add @angular/pwa
ng build --prod --baseHref /coolapp/
```


### The log given by the failure
No failure log. 
But the ngsw.json has the following output:
```
...
"navigationUrls": [
    {
      "positive": true,
      "regex": "^\\/.*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*\\.[^/]*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*__[^/]*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*__[^/]*\\/.*$"
    }
  ]
...
```

### Desired functionality
The service worker should be scoped to the baseHref location provided in the `ng build` command. 
This way other resources on the same domain can still be loaded without beeing interfeered by the service worker. 

The desired ngsw.json would be:
```
...
"navigationUrls": [
    {
      "positive": true,
      "regex": "^\\/coolapp\\/.*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*\\.[^/]*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/de\\/ \\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*__[^/]*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/de\\/ \\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*__[^/]*\\/.*$"
    }
  ]
...
```


### Mention any other details that might be useful
My Use Case:
We have an app that is shipped in multiple languages. Every language is served under a different path, e.g.:
```
https://coolapp.com/en/
https://coolapp.com/de/
```
When changing the language both service workers do collide in their responsibility, as both match their pattern: 
```
    {
      "positive": true,
      "regex": "^\\/.*$"
    }
```
and want to serve their `index.html`. By scoping them to their respective location on the server they do not collide anymore. 

### Workaround (nasty)
Define different `"ngswConfigPath": "src/ngsw-config.json"` (full duplicates) in your `angular.json` for each environment and specify the `navigationUrls` accordingly:
```
"navigationUrls": [
    "/de/**",
    "!/**/*.*",
    "! /**/*__*",
    "! /**/*__*/**"
  ]
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ServiceWorker: Standard NavigationUrls do not respect baseHref " (#27953)

Issues.Title: Improve router unit testing docs
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs bug report

### Description

Please cover the following topics thoroughly in the Angular docs:
- Unit testing a router module
- Unit testing a component which uses a router-outlet

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Both router docs sections (tutorial and fundamentals) don't really mention unit testing.

The live example project on the routing fundamentals page doesn't have unit tests.

In the API docs, two of the utilities don't have examples; the third has an incomplete example (it shows how to mock the routes, but not how to set the route for your test case).

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt5
https://angular.io/guide/router
https://angular.io/api/router/testing

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): ngOnChanges only runs for binding updates
Issues.Body:
Updates ivy to trigger onChanges only when bindings update on not when properties are set.

- Currently there are still test failures in a few places, I'm not sure they are related as `core` is passing, if they are not, I'll mark them `fixMeIvy` and move on, because this PR is already pretty large
- SimpleChanges is now stored alongside the directive instance in LView. May changes had to be made to accommodate looking up directive and component instances from LView because of this.
- refactors hooks.ts slightly
- Adds handling for `onChanges` events to `hooks.ts` in `callHooks`.
- Fixes a bug where ngBaseDef creation was not honoring pre-existing ngComponentDef and ngDirectiveDef items
- Updates the Inherit Definition Feature to support inheriting onChanges
- Removes NgOnChangesFeature

### Addendum

- Also solves an issue where `ts_web_test_suite` rule was sometimes adding `init_browser_spec.js` out of order, causing Karma tests to fail when examining uninitialized `isNode` variable in global scope.
- Had to increase the payload limit of hello-world to `187437` from `185238`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): ngOnChanges only runs for binding updates" (#27965)

Issues.Title: ngcc tries reading schematic "package.json" files
Issues.Body:
Currently in our `cli-hello-world-ivy` integration test:

```
Failed to read entry point info from /home/circleci/ng/integration/cli-hello-world-ivy/node_modules/@schematics/angular/workspace/files/package.json with error SyntaxError: Unexpected token < in JSON at position 1121.
```

It looks like this happens because ngcc just tries to read all `package.json` files and `@schematics/angular` ships their templated `package.json` file without using the `.template` suffix.

I suspect the real fix would be that `@schematics/angular` just uses the `.template` suffix for their templated files, so that ngcc does not even try to read it.

We can move this issue to the CLI if @petebacondarwin thinks that this is the right solution, but I've submitted it here to see if there is something ngcc needs to handle differently.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ngcc tries reading schematic "package.json" files" (#27950)

}
`

Create projectB(ng new projectB)
Generate as library B(ng generate library libraryB)
Use the libraryA inside of projectB
Inside of projects/libraryB.component.ts, declare variable.
`
readonly enum = SomeEnum.SOMEVALUE ;
`

Then build as library (ng build libraryB)

`
enum2 = SomeEnum.SomeValue; // does import but doesn't set attribute to value
readonly enum3: SomeEnum = SomeEnum.SomeValue; // does import but doesn't set attribute to value
enum4: SomeEnum = SomeEnum.SomeValue;  // does import but doesn't set attribute to value
`

### The log given by the failure
error TS1254: A 'const' initializer in an ambient context must be a string or numeric literal or literal enum reference.

### Desired functionality
After compiling, the enum should be imported.

Issues.Title: Use ".template" suffix for schematic template files
Issues.Body:
Currently in the `cli-hello-world-ivy` integration test for `angular/angular`:

```
Failed to read entry point info from /home/circleci/ng/integration/cli-hello-world-ivy/node_modules/@schematics/angular/workspace/files/package.json with error SyntaxError: Unexpected token < in JSON at position 1121.
```

It looks like this happens because ngcc just tries to read all `package.json` files and **`@schematics/angular`** ships their templated `package.json` file without using the `.template` suffix.

If there is nothing opposed to switching the `package.json` to use `package.json.template`, I think that it would make sense in order to avoid such warnings/errors in general.

Note that this initially caused errors for NGCC, but has been switched to a warning in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/26539.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use ".template" suffix for schematic template files" (#13378)

Issues.Title: ServiceWorker: Standard NavigationUrls do not respect baseHref
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report
- [] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
-->


### Repro steps
```
ng new repro-app
ng add @angular/pwa
ng build --prod --baseHref /coolapp/
```


### The log given by the failure
No failure log. 
But the ngsw.json has the following output:
```
...
"navigationUrls": [
    {
      "positive": true,
      "regex": "^\\/.*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*\\.[^/]*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*__[^/]*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*__[^/]*\\/.*$"
    }
  ]
...
```

### Desired functionality
The service worker should be scoped to the baseHref location provided in the `ng build` command. 
This way other resources on the same domain can still be loaded without beeing interfeered by the service worker. 

The desired ngsw.json would be:
```
...
"navigationUrls": [
    {
      "positive": true,
      "regex": "^\\/coolapp\\/.*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*\\.[^/]*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/de\\/ \\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*__[^/]*$"
    },
    {
      "positive": false,
      "regex": "^\\/de\\/ \\/(?:.+\\/)?[^/]*__[^/]*\\/.*$"
    }
  ]
...
```


### Mention any other details that might be useful
My Use Case:
We have an app that is shipped in multiple languages. Every language is served under a different path, e.g.:
```
https://coolapp.com/en/
https://coolapp.com/de/
```
When changing the language both service workers do collide in their responsibility, as both match their pattern: 
```
    {
      "positive": true,
      "regex": "^\\/.*$"
    }
```
and want to serve their `index.html`. By scoping them to their respective location on the server they do not collide anymore. 

### Workaround (nasty)
Define different `"ngswConfigPath": "src/ngsw-config.json"` (full duplicates) in your `angular.json` for each environment and specify the `navigationUrls` accordingly:
```
"navigationUrls": [
    "/de/**",
    "!/**/*.*",
    "! /**/*__*",
    "! /**/*__*/**"
  ]
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ServiceWorker: Standard NavigationUrls do not respect baseHref" (#13368)

... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.11.4

### Desired functionality
I am currently building an electron app and chrome extension. Both these apps are built together and interact with each other so development of both at the same time makes sense.
Because of this I have 3 builds:

* Angular Electron Renderer App
* Angular Chrome Extension App
* Electron main (node)

I am setting up an angular project for each of these but I really want them all built at the same time. In webpack I simply add more input files and have 1 webpack build that watches and compiles all 3. 

Is there an equivalent approach in angular?

Looking forward to getting feedback, never contributed to OSS before.

Issues.Title: Lazy Loading in AOT doesn't work in 7.1.4
Issues.Body:
I`m still having the problem related on issue [#12944](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/12944).

```cmd
> ng --version

     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/


Angular CLI: 7.1.4
Node: 11.3.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.0.3
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, material, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.10.5
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.10.5
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.10.5
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.10.5
@angular-devkit/core              7.1.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.1.4
@angular/cli                      7.1.4
@angular/flex-layout              7.0.0-beta.19
@ngtools/webpack                  7.0.5
@schematics/angular               7.1.4
@schematics/update                0.11.4
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.19.1
```

## Repro steps
### 1. Create a new project
### 2. Create a lazy module

I'm using this `app.routing.ts`:

```js
import { Routes, RouterModule, PreloadAllModules  } from '@angular/router';
import { ModuleWithProviders } from '@angular/core';

export const routes: Routes = [
    { path: '', loadChildren: './pages/dashboard/dashboard.module#DashboardModule', data: { breadcrumb: 'Dashboard' } },
    { path: '**', redirectTo: '', pathMatch: 'full'},
];

export const routing: ModuleWithProviders = RouterModule.forRoot(routes, {
   preloadingStrategy: PreloadAllModules
});
```

### 3. Run an AOT serve or build.

Call build/serve using `--aot`

```cmd
> ng serve --aot
```

And, then, get an error on your browser console:

```js
ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): Error: Cannot find module './pages/dashboard/dashboard.module'
Error: Cannot find module './pages/dashboard/dashboard.module'
    at $_lazy_route_resource lazy namespace object:23
    at ZoneDelegate.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.ZoneDelegate.invoke (zone.js:388)
    at Object.onInvoke (core.js:14143)
    at ZoneDelegate.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.ZoneDelegate.invoke (zone.js:387)
    at Zone.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.Zone.run (zone.js:138)
    at zone.js:872
    at ZoneDelegate.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:421)
    at Object.onInvokeTask (core.js:14134)
    at ZoneDelegate.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:420)
    at Zone.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.Zone.runTask (zone.js:188)
    at resolvePromise (zone.js:814)
    at resolvePromise (zone.js:771)
    at zone.js:873
    at ZoneDelegate.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:421)
    at Object.onInvokeTask (core.js:14134)
    at ZoneDelegate.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:420)
    at Zone.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone.js.Zone.runTask (zone.js:188)
    at drainMicroTaskQueue (zone.js:595)
```

_Originally posted by @danielpcampagna in https://github.com/_render_node/MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQ1MTUyNzk0OQ==/timeline/issue_comment#issuecomment-451527949_

```
                }
              ],
              "optimization": true,
              "outputHashing": "all",
              "sourceMap": false,
              "extractCss": true,
              "namedChunks": false,
              "aot": true,
              "extractLicenses": true,
              "vendorChunk": false,
              "buildOptimizer": true,
              "budgets": [
                {
                  "type": "initial",
                  "maximumWarning": "2mb",
                  "maximumError": "5mb"
                }
              ]
            }
          }
        }
```

I have searched and have found several issues related to this, but they were all old and fixed by now.

Thanks for your help. I haven't had time yet to produce a simplified repo but please let me know if you need that or anything else to move forward.

Issues.Title: Enhance build configuration
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x] feature request
```

### Desired functionality
We are attempting to migrate an existing application from Angular 5 to 6+ and have run into a substantial blocker. We understand that support for ejecting projects from the CLI has been removed and we need more robust configuration support from Angular/CLI.

We've been looking at ngx-build-plus, and are concerned that it doesn't provide the granularity of control that an ejected webpack configuration script does. We have a need for the following:

- Edit existing webpack plugins
- Add new plugins (definePlugin)
- Configure variant build processes via inline parameters by setting environment variables and using them in the configuration script
- Configure additional entry/output properties for custom script inclusion

Any assistance that can be provided by the Angular/CLI team or this community would be appreciated.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enhance build configuration" (#13360)

Issues.Title: Update from LTS version to LTS version
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [x] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```


### Desired functionality
At our company we want to be able update our Angular apps from LTS version to LTS version.
As it currently stands, this doesn't seem to be possible with `ng update`, as it will always update to the latest available (stable) version of Angular.

It would be great if you could add this functionality in the form of a new option `--lts` (so this will update to the latest available LTS version) or something like that, so that one will be able to update an Angular app from version 5 to version 6 even though version 7 (or later) got already released. :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Update from LTS version to LTS version" (#13358)

Issues.Title: Production build css url does not use data URI scheme
Issues.Body:
After upgrading to angular 7 (from angular 6) CSS urls are no longer having data URI in production build. All images on my site are broken when I deploy the app.

### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions

Linux: Ubuntu 16.04
Node: v10.14.2
npm: 6.4.1

ng --version:

```
@angular-devkit/architect         0.11.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.11.0
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.11.0
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.11.0
@angular-devkit/core              7.1.0
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.1.3
@angular/cdk                      7.2.0
@angular/cli                      7.1.3
@angular/material                 7.2.0
@ngtools/webpack                  7.1.0
@schematics/angular               7.1.3
@schematics/update                0.11.3
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.23.1
```


### Repro steps

I define my css image urls as e.g.

```
.resize {
  background-image: url("../../assets/symbol.png");
}
```

And after `ng build --prod`

The url on my live server is rendered as:

```
.resize {
  background-image: url("data:image/png;base64...");
}
```

However, after the upgrade to angular 7, the url becomes:

```
.resize {
  background-image: url("symbol.png");
}
```

### The log given by the failure

No log.

### Desired functionality

I want  to be able to use data URI instead of relative/absolute url, when production build is compiled.


### Mention any other details that might be useful

* My base href is set to "/" in all config files - I musn't change it because it would break all my API calls
* Probably unrelated, but since the upgrade when I try to create new component, I get `Two or more projects are using identical roots. Unable to determine project using current working directory. Using default workspace project instead.` warning
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Production build css url does not use data URI scheme" (#13355)

<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
-->

```
Angular CLI: 7.1.4
Node: 10.13.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.1.4
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.11.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.11.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.11.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.11.4
@angular-devkit/core              7.1.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.1.4
@ngtools/webpack                  7.1.4
@schematics/angular               7.1.4
@schematics/update                0.11.4
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.23.1
```

### Desired functionality
<!--
What would like to see implemented?
What is the usecase?
-->
The default `"target"` in `tsconfig.json` generated by `ng new` should be `"es6"`, not `"es5"`.

Reasons:
1. Modern browsers are being optimized for ES6 now. ES5 is no longer necessary or optimal.
2. Smaller generated code files.
3. Fewer problems out-of-the box (without having to use flags that new users might not know about), e.g. https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/3164 

I understand this is a judgement call, and there could be reasons I don't know about to keep the default as es5. If so, I'd like to hear what those are, since I believe it is better to move forward. Apps that have to support Internet Explorer already need to include some polyfills, and I think they're in the minority, so the default should cater to the majority -- users that really *should* be targeting ES6, and may not even think to change the settings in their `tsconfig.json` file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Default target should be ES6 in generated tsconfig.json" (#13352)

Issues.Title: Polyfills should work the same in dev and production builds
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Polyfills should work the same in dev and production builds

#### What is the current behavior?
We use angular material for displaying a simple dialog. The problem occurs only in Internet Explorer 11 in combination with the core-js/es6/weak-map polyfill. First we forgot to include this polyfill but in dev mode the dialog still worked. But when we tested the production build the dialog did not open and throwed an error. Now it's clear for us that it should fail because of the missing polyfill. But why is it working in dev mode without the polyfill?

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
At the moment we can not provide a stackblitz example because you cannot set dev/prod mode.
We have a sample cli based project to show the issue here: https://github.com/olmero/matdialog-ie11.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.1 (project generated with cli)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Polyfills should work the same in dev and production builds" (#14743)

Issues.Title: Useless scrollbar on main page when dialog is shown
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

No additionnal useless scrollbar should be shown

#### What is the current behavior?

A useless disabled scrollbar is shown on main `<html>` tag, but it is not necessary

#### Explanations

It may be related to the way my page is built (I don't see this issue with the Dialog in the docs for example). When the dialog is opened, it creates a useless disabled scollbar for full page but it is never necessary.

To solve this, I just added this to my css:
```
.cdk-global-scrollblock {
  overflow-y: auto !important;
}
```
Whereas the default value is `scroll` which explains why it shows the disabled scrollbar.

If it is safe for other setups, the value should be `auto` by default. Or am I missing something?

Example in picture: note the disabled scrollbar:
![Example](https://i.imgur.com/uR2csLF.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Useless scrollbar on main page when dialog is shown" (#14742)

Issues.Title: Allow interacted field of matStep in the stepper control to be editable via property binding
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

The interacted field of the matStep (https://material.angular.io/components/stepper/api) is currently not decorated with @Input() therefore it is not possible to use property binding to modify it.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

Calling the Stepper Previous() or Next() method ends up calling "CdkStepper.prototype._anyControlsInvalidOrPending" where there is a check for "!step.interacted". I have a use case where I populate the steps and then set a particular step as the selected step.  At that point when I call next or previous since the steps interacted field is false by default I'm not able to go backward or forward through the stepper.  

At the moment my only way to solve this issue is to iterate the stepper's "_steps" and set the "interacted" field to true.  This is not an ideal solution.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

Version: 7.2.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow interacted field of matStep in the stepper control to be editable via property binding" (#14724)
